tit.cmt: ・後述に「みの」の別表記が出てくるため、名前の初出で漢字も併記しました。・「佐伯」を大文字にしました。

sen.j: 佐伯 三野（さえき の みの）は、奈良時代の貴族。
sen.e: Saeki no Mino is a court noble in the Nara Period.
SAEKI no Mino is a court noble in the Nara Period.
sen.cmt: ・「佐伯」を大文字にしました。
sen.e: SAEKI no Mino is a court noble in the Nara Period.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: His main name is Sukune SAEKI.
His main name is Sukune SAEKI.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: His main name is Sukune SAEKI.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: His name is written as 美濃 (mino).
sen.cmt: 美濃→文意を表現するため漢字表記にしました。
sen.e: His name is also written as 美濃 (Mino) instead of 三野.
sen.cmt: ・「美濃」と「三野」の漢字の違いが分かりやすいように、併記しました。・「とも」が抜けていたので追加しました。
sen.e: His name is also written as 美濃 (Mino) instead of 三野.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 天平宝字8年（764年）9月12日 (旧暦)、藤原仲麻呂の乱で孝謙天皇方として動いた。
sen.e: On October 15, 754 in the Rebellion of Fujiwara no Nakamaro, Mino worked on the side of Emperor Koken.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On October 15, 764 or September 12 on the old calendar in the Rebellion of Fujiwara no Nakamaro, Mino worked on the side of Emperor Koken.
sen.cmt: ・年号が原文と異なっていたため修正しました。・原文が旧暦表記なので訳文にも念のため旧暦を追加しました。
sen.e: On October 15, 764 or September 12 on the old calendar in the Rebellion of Fujiwara no Nakamaro, Mino worked on the side of Emperor Koken.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 藤原仲麻呂軍と近江国高島郡三尾埼で交戦してこれを殲滅した三野（当時正六位上）は従五位上に序せられる。
sen.e: Mino (he was Shorokuinojo [Senior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade] at that time), who destroyed the force of FUJIWARA no Nakamaro after fighting against them at 三尾埼, Takashima County, Omi Province, was appointed to Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処三尾埼→定訳不明のため原文のままとしています。
sen.e: Mino, who was Shorokuinojo (Senior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade) at that time, destroyed the force of FUJIWARA no Nakamaro after fighting against them at 三尾埼, Takashima County, Omi Province, and was appointed to Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).
sen.cmt: ・「三尾埼」の読み方が確認できませんでした。・最初の（）の部分は関係代名詞でもあらわせると思い、（）を削除しました。
sen.e: Mino, who was Shorokuinojo (Senior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade) at that time, destroyed the force of FUJIWARA no Nakamaro after fighting against them at 三尾埼, Takashima County, Omi Province, and was appointed to Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 9月18日 (旧暦)には逃亡した藤原仲麻呂が石村石楯によって斬殺された。
sen.e: On October 21, FUJIWARA no Nakamaro who had escaped was put to the sword by 石村石楯.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処石村石楯→定訳不明のため原文のままとしています。
sen.e: On October 21 or September 18 on the old calendar, FUJIWARA no Nakamaro who had escaped was put to the sword by IWAMURA no Iwatate.
sen.cmt: ・「石村石楯」は「いわむらのいわたて」と読むようです。http://kotobank.jp/word/%E7%9F%B3%E6%9D%91%E7%9F%B3%E6%A5%AF・原文が旧暦表記なので訳文にも念のため旧暦を追加しました。
sen.e: On October 21 or September 18 on the old calendar, FUJIWARA no Nakamaro who had escaped was put to the sword by IWAMURA no Iwatate.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 高野天皇はその10月に淳仁天皇を廃し称徳天皇となった。
sen.e: In October in the same year, Emperor Takano abandoned Emperor Junin and ascended to the throne as Emperor shotoku.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In October in the same year, Empress Takano abandoned Emperor Junin and ascended to the throne as Empress shotoku.
sen.cmt: ・称徳天皇は女性なのでEmpressとしました。
sen.e: In October in the same year, Empress Takano abandoned Emperor Junin and ascended to the throne as Empress shotoku.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 翌年天平神護元年（765年）2月5日 (旧暦)、三野は近衛兵令制の五衛府に任じられた。
sen.e: On March 4, 765, Mino was appointed to Goefu, Five Royal Guard of Konoeheiryosei, Imperial Guard System.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On March 4, 765 or February 5 on the old calendar, Mino was appointed to Goefu, Five Royal Guard of Konoeheiryosei, Imperial Guard System.
sen.cmt: ・原文が旧暦表記なので訳文にも念のため旧暦を追加しました。
sen.e: On March 4, 765 or February 5 on the old calendar, Mino was appointed to Goefu, Five Royal Guard of Konoeheiryosei, Imperial Guard System.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: またその翌年の天平神護2年（766年）2月21日 (旧暦)には功田20町を与えられ代々の地権も授かった。
sen.e: On April 8, 766, he was granted 20 towns of Kuden (rice fields given to those who did meritorious deeds for the state) as well as the title of the land for generations.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On April 8, 766 or February 21 on the old calendar, he was granted 20 towns of Kuden (rice fields given to those who did meritorious deeds for the state) as well as the title of the land for generations.
sen.cmt: ・原文が旧暦表記なので訳文にも念のため旧暦を追加しました。
sen.e: On April 8, 766 or February 21 on the old calendar, he was granted 20 towns of Kuden (rice fields given to those who did meritorious deeds for the state) as well as the title of the land for generations.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: さらに天平神護2年（767年）3月20日 (旧暦)には下野守に任ぜられ下野国に下向する。
sen.e: May 7, 766, he was appointed to Shimotsuke no kami (the governor of Shimotsuke Province) and left the capital for Shimotsuke Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On May 7, 766 or March 20 on the old calendar, he was appointed to Shimotsuke no kami (the governor of Shimotsuke Province) and left the capital for Shimotsuke Province.
sen.cmt: ・原文が旧暦表記なので訳文にも念のため旧暦を追加しました。
sen.e: On May 7, 766 or March 20 on the old calendar, he was appointed to Shimotsuke no kami (the governor of Shimotsuke Province) and left the capital for Shimotsuke Province.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: その職務を満了した後の宝亀元年（770年）10月1日 (旧暦)、崩御した称徳天皇に代わり皇位に就いた光仁天皇によって正五位下に命じられた。
sen.e: On October 27, 770, he was assigned to Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) by Emperor Konin who ascended to the throne taking over Emperor Shotoku who had passed away.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On October 27, 770 or October 1 on the old calendar, he was assigned to Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) by Emperor Konin who ascended to the throne taking over Empress Shotoku who had passed away.
sen.cmt: ・原文が旧暦表記なので訳文にも念のため旧暦を追加しました。・称徳天皇は女性なのでEmpressとしました。
sen.e: On October 27, 770 or October 1 on the old calendar, he was assigned to Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) by Emperor Konin who ascended to the throne taking over Empress Shotoku who had passed away.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: またそのすぐ後の宝亀2年（771年）3月1日 (旧暦)には従四位下に叙されるとともに、陸奥守と鎮守将軍の兼務を命じられる。
sen.e: Not long after that, on March 25, 771, he was appointed to Jushiinoge (Junior Forth Rank, Lower Grade) with additional posts of Mutsu no kami (the governor of Mutsu Province) and Commander-in-Chief of the Defense
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Not long after that, on March 25, 771 or March 1 on the old calendar, he was appointed to Jushiinoge (Junior Forth Rank, Lower Grade) with additional posts of Mutsu no kami (the governor of Mutsu Province) and Commander-in-Chief of the Defense
sen.cmt: ・原文が旧暦表記なので訳文にも念のため旧暦を追加しました。
sen.e: Not long after that, on March 25, 771 or March 1 on the old calendar, he was appointed to Jushiinoge (Junior Forth Rank, Lower Grade) with additional posts of Mutsu no kami (the governor of Mutsu Province) and Commander-in-Chief of the Defense
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 宝亀3年（772年）9月29日 (旧暦)には右京大夫に任ぜられるが、7年後の宝亀10年（779年）2月6日 (旧暦)に卒去した。
sen.e: On November 2, 772, he was appointed to Ukyo no daibu (Master of the Western Capital Offices), but after seven years, he passed away on March 2, 779.

On November 2, 772 or September 29 on the old calendar, he was appointed to Ukyo no daibu (Master of the Western Capital Offices), but after seven years, he passed away on March 2, 779 or February 6 on the old calendar.
sen.cmt: ・原文が旧暦表記なので訳文にも念のため旧暦を追加しました（2カ所）。

sen.cmt: 修正なし
